sen.j: 宗叡（しゅうえい・しゅえい、大同 (日本)4年（809年） － 元慶8年3月26日 (旧暦)（884年4月29日））は、平安時代前期の真言宗の僧。
sen.e: Shuei (26th March 809 - 29th April 884) was a Shingon Sect Buddhist monk who lived during the first part of the Heian period.

sen.e: He was one of the eight priests (Saicho, Kukai, Jogyo, Engyo, Ennin, Eun, Enchin and Shuei) who travelled to Tang Dynasty China.

sen.j: 14歳で比叡山に入り載鎮に師事して出家し、のちに興福寺の義演から法相教学を、延暦寺の義真から天台教学を、円珍から金剛界・胎蔵界両部を、実慧から真言密教を学び、禅林寺 (京都市)の真紹から灌頂を受けた。
sen.e: At age 14, he went to Mt. Hiei where he entered the Buddhist priesthood under Saichin before later learning the Hosso Sect teachings from Gien of Kofuku-ji Temple, the Tendai Sect teachings from Gishin of Enryaku-ji Temple, Diamond Realm and Womb Realm mandalas from Enchin, Shingon Sect teachings from Jitsue, and being consecrated by Shinsho of Zenrin-ji Temple (Kyoto City).

sen.e: In the year 862, he travelled to Tang Dynasty China with Cloistered Imperial Prince Shinnyo.

sen.j: 五台山 (中国)・天台山を巡礼し、また汴州の玄慶、長安の法全などに密教を学んで、865年（貞観7年）に帰国。
sen.e: He made pilgrimages to Mt. Wutai and Mt. Tiantai and studied esoteric Buddhism under monks including Xuanqung of Bianzhou and Faquan of Changan before returning to Japan in the year 865.

sen.j: 869年（貞観11年）に権律師、879年（元慶3年）僧正に任じられ、東大寺別当・東寺二長者も歴任している。
sen.e: Shuei was promoted to Gon-Risshi in 869, and in the year 879 was successively appointed Sojo, betto (administrator) of Todai-ji Temple and second abbot of To-ji Temple.

sen.j: 清和天皇の帰依を受け、天皇が出家する際にはその戒師もつとめた。
sen.e: He received the devotion of Emperor Seiwa and served as kaishi (the priest who imparts the Buddhist commandments) when the emperor entered the priesthood.
